data.title: Passage: Keizo Obuchi, 62
data.meta_description: The former Japanese prime minister died Sunday of complications from the stroke he suffered in early April that left him in a coma and ended his 20-month stay in office. Obuchi, considered a bland and colorless careerist, nevertheless embarked on an aggressive spending policy to try and pull Japan's struggling economy out of its long recession. How Obuchi will ultimately be remembered probably hinges on the success or failure of the course he set.

As the video game industry contracts, indie developers are left with fewer options for funding. Innersloth has some ideas for how to provide a lifeline.
